Sentencas: The ability of combined heat and power (CHP) to meet residential heat and power demands efficiently offers potentially significant financial and environmental advantages over centralised power g neration and heat-provision through natural-gas fired boilers.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential micro-combined heat and power in the UK: Key economic drivers

Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) can operate at high overall efficiencies (heat and power) of 80-90%, offering an improvement over centralised generation, which is often unable to utilise waste heat.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential micro-combined heat and power in the UK: Key economic drivers

Sentencas: This paper applies an equivalent annual cost (EAC) minimisation model to a residential solid oxide fuel cell CHP system to determine what the driving factors are behind investment in this technology.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential micro-combined heat and power in the UK: Key economic drivers

Sentencas: We explore the performance of a hypothetical SOFC system-representing expectations of near to medium term technology development-under present UK market conditions.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential micro-combined heat and power in the UK: Key economic drivers

Sentencas: We find that households with small to average energy demands do not benefit from installation of a SOFC micro-CHP system, but larger energy demands do benefit under these conditions.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential micro-combined heat and power in the UK: Key economic drivers

Sentencas: However, this result is sensitive to a number of factors including stack capital cost, energy import and export prices, and plant lifetime.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential micro-combined heat and power in the UK: Key economic drivers

Sentencas: The results for small and average dwellings are shown to reverse under an observed change in energy import prices, an increase in electricity export price, a decrease in stack capital costs, or an improvement in stack lifetime.
Titulo: Solid oxide fuel cell systems for residential micro-combined heat and power in the UK: Key economic drivers
